steps: Navigate to Settings > Leave > Leave Policies
Enable Leave Salary Settings by toggling the option in the leave policy
Create a new leave salary policy in Payroll Settings under 'Leave Salary Policy'
Define the policy name and description
Select applicable leave types for the policy
Configure the leave salary calculation formula and select allowance components
Add eligible employees to the policy, applying probation restrictions if necessary
Review and save the leave salary policy
what_to_do.expected_outcome: A leave salary policy is configured and active, with eligible employees assigned and salary calculation rules defined.

steps: Navigate to Finance > Leave Salary
Review pending leave salary requests and check eligibility
Approve or reject requests as appropriate
Optionally overwrite approved amounts before final approval
Add approved leave salary amounts to the payroll table
Process leave salary transactions
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Leave salary requests are reviewed, approved or rejected, and approved amounts are correctly added to payroll for processing.

steps: Submit leave salary transactions for processing
Filter employees by 'leave salary' request type
Calculate prorated salaries based on leave periods and working day settings
Create Variable Pay File (VPF) for payroll integration
Adjust payroll for leave periods, considering different working day settings and allowance exclusions
Update payroll table and add transaction remarks
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Leave salary transactions are accurately calculated, processed, and integrated into payroll with appropriate adjustments and documentation.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The report lacks flexible sorting, precise number formatting, and comprehensive employee data fields. It is generated on-the-go, restricting real-time customization and immediate client-requested modifications.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: No direct workaround; users must work within existing report constraints.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Currency display mismatch on Leave Salary landing page
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The landing page currency label is static and does not dynamically reflect the company's configured currency, causing potential user confusion.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users should verify currency correctness in leave salary requests rather than relying on the landing page label.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Leave Salary policy assignment timing affects eligibility
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system does not support retroactive leave salary policy assignments; eligibility is fixed at request creation time.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Ensure policies are assigned before leave requests are created to guarantee eligibility.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Multiple leave requests for leaves spanning multiple cycles
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system generates separate leave salary requests for each leave cycle, requiring manual tracking and approval.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Administrators must manually track and approve related requests separately.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Lack of month-specific leave salary breakdown
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform does not display leave salary allocation by month for multi-month leave requests, only aggregate totals.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users must manually calculate or infer month-by-month allocations outside the system.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Inconsistent leave salary report downloads for individual staff
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users cannot directly download leave salary reports for specific staff members via standard interface.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Use manual report downloads via Payroll table reports as an alternative.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Lack of clear guidance on leave salary encashment functions leads to misconfigurations and misunderstandings.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users should consult support or documentation for encashment setup clarity.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Incomplete payroll templates missing leave salary details
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Payroll templates lack detailed leave salary policy breakdowns and unpaid leave counts, limiting comprehensive payroll validation.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual reconciliation and additional reporting may be required.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Leave salary request generation constrained by payroll cycle rules
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Requests starting before the current payroll cycle cannot be processed automatically, requiring manual splitting.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manually split leave requests to align with payroll cycles.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Inconsistent synchronization between leave approval and payroll queue
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Not all approved leave requests propagate automatically to leave salary queue, causing processing gaps.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual verification and intervention may be needed to ensure payroll queue accuracy.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Lack of automated notifications for payroll managers on leave salary policy setup
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: No automatic alerts are sent when new leave salary-enabled policies are configured, requiring manual communication.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: HR teams must manually notify payroll managers of policy changes.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No comprehensive end-to-end testing for leave salary request generation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Testing infrastructure lacks full coverage for leave salary request workflows.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Testing must be supplemented with manual or partial automated tests.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Lack of comprehensive technical documentation for leave salary
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Insufficient documentation on leave salary calculations and rules limits user understanding.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users must rely on support or internal knowledge until documentation is improved.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Missing 'Leave Salary' filter in payroll table
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users cannot filter payroll data by leave salary, limiting reporting customization.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Use alternative filtering or manual data extraction methods.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: User confusion on posting leave salary transactions
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The workflow for posting leave salary transactions is not intuitive or clearly guided.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users should refer to support or training materials for transaction posting procedures.
